text: An NPR review of the federal cases brought in connection with the unrest over George Floyd's death does not find any links to the antifa movement.
As the country seethes after George Floyd's killing, three black men from South Los Angeles who lived through the Watts or Rodney King riots share their ideas of what just policing would look like.
A day after Democrats rolled out policing reform bill, Senate Republicans created a group to draft a plan. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell asked S.C Sen. Tim Scott to take the lead.
White Fragility author Robin DiAngelo says that the status quo in the United States is racism, and for white people, that's comfortable. "We've got to start making it uncomfortable," she says.
The Code Switch team has been reporting on race, policing and protest since it was launched in 2013. Here's some of the best coverage from the past seven years.
How Much Do We Need The Police?
A Decade Of Watching Black People Die
George Floyd's death at the hands of police sparked protests around the world. His family's private service Tuesday follows public memorials that drew thousands of mourners.

Microaggressions are the everyday, thinly veiled instances of racism, homophobia, sexism and other biases that come across in gestures, comments or insults. But the "micro" doesn't mean that the acts don't have a big impact. While there's no one right way to address a microaggression, we have some pointers for ways you can begin to respond.

In the city of Atlanta, voters waited upwards of three hours at some polling places as social distancing measures decreased the number of voting machines and people inside a polling place at one time.

Researchers cast a backward look to see what might have happened during the first months of the coronavirus crisis without any preventive measures.
Nursing homes banned all visitors and nonessential workers from their facilities in mid-March to stop the spread of COVID-19. Advocates and families want that ban to end.

A Jerusalem hotel hosted 180 quarantined COVID-19 patients from different backgrounds. Despite concerns they might clash, some became friends. The biggest test of togetherness came during Passover.
